Articles.Content:
I'm baffled by this; the Linq Find() method clearly finds an instanced object, as it is able to print the object's name to the debug console, but the null reference check below it triggers as if the returned object is null when clearly it isn't.

any ideas?

Sounds like you've hit Unity's most notorious and annoying quirk:

https://blogs.unity3d.com/2014/05/16/custom-operator-should-we-keep-it/

G*D F*****G D*****T!!
That's probably it then.  I guess I'll have to add in a dirty kludge using nullable booleans
